page.title: 07SELBY ABBEY
page.content: SELBY ABBEY STANDS IN THE CENTRE OF THE TOWN.IT IS A VERY LARGE ABBEY AND IS AS BIG AS A CATHEDRAL. THE ABBEY WAS FOUNDED BY ST BENEDICT IN 1069.THE ABBEY HAS BEEN ADDED TO OVER THE YEARS. IN 1690 THE TOWER FELL DOWN AND DESTROYED THE SOUTH TRANSEPT. DURING OCTOBER 1906 THE ABBEY CAUGHT FIRE AND WAS COMPLETELY BURNT OUT.FIRE MEN'S HOSES KEPT THE GLASS COOL AND SOME OF THE WINDOWS WERE SAVED. IN 1969,AS PART OF THE 900th. ANNIVERSARY CELEBRATIONS,THE QUEEN DISTRIBUTED THE ROYAL MAUNDY IN THE ABBEY. THE ABBEY IS SELBY'S PARISH CHURCH AND IS A TOURIST ATTRACTION. AS YOU APPROACH SELBY FROM ANY DIRECTION THE ABBEY STANDS OUT AND IS THE FIRST BUILDING THAT YOU CAN SEE.
